website_summaries.verdict: This kit offers both quality and features that will enhance your eclipse viewing experience.
pros: Durable and attractive eclipse viewing glasses with plastic frames in a wrap-around design
Kit comes with an ISO photo filter and eclipse viewing guide book
cons: They are selling out quickly, so it's hard to catch them in stock

customer_reviews.title: See the sun like never before!
customer_reviews.text: These glasses are properly rated for sun spotting and I got them for the upcoming eclipse. I tried them out upon arrival and noticed you cannot see anything through them except for the sun. When you put them on, be prepared to see the sun like never before! I was amazed to see the dark spot on the sun with my own eyes! Up to this point, I've only seen it in pictures and documentaries. With care, these glasses will last a long time and can be used for sun spotting well after this eclipse.
customer_reviews.author: Tom H.

customer_reviews.title: Eye doc said they were ok
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for the eclipse so I haven't used them. I took them to my eye doc to make sure they were ok and he said they were. Looking forward to using them.
customer_reviews.author: Pinupgirl

customer_reviews.title: Sounds like other customers had the same experience
customer_reviews.text: The left eyepiece/lens on ALL 5 glasses were bent and wrinkled. Warning on the glasses states, "Do not use if damaged". So I can't use these glasses. Sounds like other customers had the same experience.
customer_reviews.author: WAA

customer_reviews.title: Excited to use these for the upcoming eclipse.
customer_reviews.text: Unbelievably quick shipping (standard shipping selected) in a padded envelope. I tested the product already and have looked at the sun with comfort and no symptoms related to eye discomfort/damage. Excited to use these for the upcoming eclipse.
customer_reviews.author: featherlashes

customer_reviews.title: Bad Packaging
customer_reviews.text: Glasses were folded across right lens. Not sure they will work.
customer_reviews.author: Haley Ozone

customer_reviews.title: Careless packaging from a "precision" optical co.
customer_reviews.text: Eclipse glasses arrived bent and wrinkled right through every lens-right thru the warning that says"Do not use if damaged" Basically the glasses were balled up to fit in a box that was too small. While this is a pretty insignificant purchase, I would certainly be very leery and cautious about purchasing any precision optics from anyone this careless.
customer_reviews.author: J Mac

customer_reviews.title: they fit over my glasses
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for the eclipse that is coming up next month, I tried one out and it works great over my glasses
customer_reviews.author: Dave K.

customer_reviews.title: Pefectly priced, certified glasses for the Solar Eclipse!!
customer_reviews.text: It is critical that you purchase ISO and CE Certified eclipse glasses for the up coming solar eclipse! These are well priced, certified glasses that came in 2 days! They are perfect. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: M. Reed

customer_reviews.title: They will work...but shipping method needs to change as to not crinkle lens
customer_reviews.text: I can already tell that these will work however when they arrived they were folded right down the middle of the one the lenses so ALL 10 have crinkles in one of the lens itself. Bummer but they will work. Since they are pitch black unless you look straight into the sun they are not damaged enough not to use...I just would have hoped for better shipping.
customer_reviews.author: Jeannie

customer_reviews.title: I Can See The Sun And Nothing Else!
customer_reviews.text: Ordered on August 8 via Prime and arrived today, August 10. The packaging was great... a big box and large air-filled plastic cushioning to protect the contents. I just took one of the glasses out to test. I put the spectacles on then looked up to where the Sun was and I couldn't see anything else but the Sun and surrounding darkness. The viewing was comfortable. These are just as advertised and should be excellent for viewing the upcoming eclipse. See the attached photos I uploaded.
customer_reviews.author: Boojiboy1

customer_reviews.title: the parcel was folded and 1 side of glasses broke ...
customer_reviews.text: the parcel was folded and 1 side of glasses broke. Not sure how they are going to work at the eclipse.
customer_reviews.author: ASGS

customer_reviews.title: Plastic Lens warped
customer_reviews.text: Lens was wrinkled and distorts the view. Other then that they are as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Arrived damaged!
customer_reviews.text: Bought these on August 4th and they finally arrived today. They are damaged. I'm not happy at all. I'd give negative stars if I could.
customer_reviews.author: Susan B. Ledford

customer_reviews.title: BEWARE of HORRIBLE PACKAGING that caused a crease to the left lens of all 10 pair
customer_reviews.text: Fortunately, after checking each one with a strong flashlight, I don't think the lenses are actually damaged as far as allowing the sunlight to penetrate through a hole or tear... BUT the village idiots that packed them folded them through the lens instead of through the nose section... Better yet, use a bigger package and don't fold them at all. Good Grief!
customer_reviews.author: Homeschool Mom

customer_reviews.title: Solar Eclipse Glasses Shipped Bent Across Lenses
customer_reviews.text: These were delivered in a padded envelope, which was fine and undamaged, but the glasses inside were bent in half across the lenses. Any sort of damage to the lens of glasses meant to protect one from looking up at a solar eclipse renders the glasses useless. It looks like the glasses were carelessly jammed into the bag. Very disappointing. Will try to order again and hope for the best because I don't have time to research another brand and confirm they safe to use.
customer_reviews.author: Private

customer_reviews.title: Glasses are what they claim to be.
customer_reviews.text: I thought I needed to leave a positive review with so many negative lately. My glasses arrived in fine condition. I'm attaching photos to show the safety stamp. Not anything fancy, but will do the job
customer_reviews.author: Mk95

customer_reviews.title: Poor manufacturing.
customer_reviews.text: As noted by others, the right lens (left if facing from the outside) is 'wrinkled' on all five pair. They do not appear to be damaged, but rather that a poor job was done in the manufacture, not 'flattening' the lens on that side prior to the pieces of cardboard being fastened down. Because this brand/style/maker is on the NASA-approved list and because in the sunlight today they did appear to meet standards, I will keep them. But should I ever need any kind of solar viewing equipment in the future, this is NOT the company that I will go to.
customer_reviews.author: vn dd

customer_reviews.title: I found the product to be cheaply made. I ...
customer_reviews.text: I found the product to be cheaply made. I paid 12.99 for a pack of 5 adult glasses, got the wrong size which I couldn't use. They were bent, and couldn't have been used safely by anyone. If I had young children, all things being equal, I don't know if I would trust my child's eyes to these. Now the same package is up to $39.99. Really?
customer_reviews.author: Jojomom

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: Glasses came a week late with wrinkled lenses on every pair.... sending them back as it says not to use if lenses are damaged.
customer_reviews.author: beintrees

customer_reviews.title: Received the same bent glasses everyone else did.
customer_reviews.text: Received damaged glasses, just like everyone else. They were bent.
customer_reviews.author: Jared Franklin

customer_reviews.title: I just received my 5 pairs and they were all ...
customer_reviews.text: I just received my 5 pairs and they were all bent out of shape on the right eye. I am not sure if we can use this as is says not to use if damaged. This is a bummer I took off work to show my little girls the eclipse and now not sure if we can use these glasses
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: Total Darkness
customer_reviews.text: Rec my glasses today. They arrived in perfect condition. Yes, they are all stacked together, but they are fine. One reviewer said she could see her kitchen light through them, so I took one pair out and looked at my very bright kitchen light. I could see absolutely nothing with the glasses on. I was pretty impressed by that Naturally, I can't say more because we have yet to use them. Just wanted to give my experience with the condition when received and the kitchen light test. I am as pleased as I can be, at this time, with my purchase and that is why I'm giving 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: GA Mom

customer_reviews.title: Happy 2017 Eclipse
customer_reviews.text: I went to NASA website and Lunt Solar linked me to Amazon for purchasing their NASA approved eclipse glasses. I bought them immediately because supplies everywhere are running out. After reading the negative reviews, I was worried. My order arrived in perfect condition. I can't see anything except the sun. These glasses are exactly as advertised. Delivered very quickly and are certified. Thanks!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: What a waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Just received the package today. The glasses came damaged with a crease across the entire package. What a waste of money. No time to find replacement glasses. HIGHLY DISAPPOINTED!!!
customer_reviews.author: k

customer_reviews.title: Beware
customer_reviews.text: And just as SO many people had issues ... these arrived with bent lenses.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Gordon

customer_reviews.title: They get the job done at a reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: Didn't want to spend a lot for something that would be used once, and then would be lost before the next eclipse; these glasses seem to fit the bill. Quality is consistent with the old fashioned blue and red 3-D glasses, just fine for a single event. Note that they are printed with the ISO compliance statement, but if you insist on seeing the ISO logo, look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Glenn Wagstaff

customer_reviews.title: Exactly as described. Thanks to Lunt Solar Systems for ...
customer_reviews.text: Exactly as described. Thanks to Lunt Solar Systems for getting these out on short notice! They seem to be the only manufacturer left with any supply. I was one of those who bought the made in China glasses from amazon. That seller of the cheaper glasses had claimed they were certified. About 10 days before the eclipse, I received an email from Amazon warning not to use the product. Instead of getting fakes again, I went to the AAS website, clicked the manufacturer link. From there the manufacturer linked directly to this page.
customer_reviews.author: RR

customer_reviews.title: I tested them as recommended to be sure- a super bright LED bare bulb
customer_reviews.text: Received my 5 pack of Lunt premium ISO and CE Certified solar glasses, which arrived on time. The glasses were carefully packaged - in a much larger box , cushioned by air filled plastic bubble wrap, and the glasses themselves were in a plastic sleeve, and were undamaged. They are marked with the ISO marking on the inside of the glasses frame. Just to be sure, I tested them as recommended to be sure- a super bright LED bare bulb, can barely be seen with these glasses. The sun looks more like looking at a bright orange moon, so I think we're set for the eclipse. UPDATE: Worked great for viewing today's eclipse. Upgraded my rating to 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: loblolly

customer_reviews.title: We are very happy with these glasses!
customer_reviews.text: I did a lot of research on solar glasses before making my purchase. That included talking with scientists and engineers. Lunt is the real deal. They specialize in manufacturing telescope lenses that, by nature, offer great celestial vision and protect the human eye. Their solar glasses are great. Our 10-pack arrived in a well padded box. No crinkling or damage. They are ready to put on! You can learn more about Lunt on their website, including lots of interesting information about the solar eclipse.
customer_reviews.author: Bonita J. Woods

customer_reviews.title: Bought 5, but got 4
customer_reviews.text: Bought a 5 five pack and it came will 4! Now I have to go without seeing the eclipise, so the 4 other people can see it. I EVEN SPENT EXTRA MONEY TO GET THEM EARLY!.....now there's no time to get another set.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the August 21 eclipse!
customer_reviews.text: These are actually NASA recommend glasses. Buy them if you plan to watch the eclipse. You can't see anything through them. Just pitch black. Complete nothing. And then you look at the sun, and it's actually there, a bright speck in the sky. I can honestly say that I have never seen the sun that way before. Worth every penny. Can't wait until the August 21 eclipse!
customer_reviews.author: Nabila Eve

customer_reviews.title: The real deal
customer_reviews.text: Authentic and safe! After searching and searching and reading other reviews about people not getting safe glasses I found these! They are safe for direct sun viewing and work like a charm. I'm so excited to use these and the price is great!
customer_reviews.author: Gabie A.

customer_reviews.title: Good enough for me
customer_reviews.text: Ok, these aren't optician-quality. They're cardboard frames with an easily wrinkled plastic lens. Mine also came in tight packaging, and a little bit beat-up condition. For the price, you're getting what you paid for. All that said, I've seen better ones, and they're close enough for me. I took mine outside this morning and used them to look directly at the full (i.e., un-eclipsed) sun -- in Florida. Not only do I still have my eyesight, but it wasn't even uncomfortable; actually kind of neat. I'm not going to guarantee your experience or your eyesight, but for me, they worked well enough.
customer_reviews.author: Eric P

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!!
customer_reviews.text: These are great!! Arrived undamaged and went outside to test them. Sun was a little orange ball, and the sun was the only thing I could see through these. I'm so looking forward to the eclipse!!
customer_reviews.author: TattooedNurse

customer_reviews.title: Made of very poor quality dark plastic film
customer_reviews.text: Made of very poor quality dark plastic film, a piece of junk, However I compared to a standard shade 14 (minimum shade needed for watching sun safely) welding glass, this product has no shade rating (I won't trust its printed rating even if there were any ratings because of poor quality), but should be OK for a couple of minutes using for solar eclipse, I guess.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Seem like quality glasses. Good packaging/No damage.
customer_reviews.text: We haven't used these glasses yet because we purchased them for the upcoming eclipse, so I will have to update my review after that. But they appear to be legit and are very very dark. Ours did NOT come damaged in any way, so I'm guessing they have resolved the packaging issues that so many others have complained about. These seem to be good value!
customer_reviews.author: KourtE

customer_reviews.title: Packers are worthless
customer_reviews.text: Product could have got 5 stars but sense packaging ruined the lenses making them useless they get 3. Something needs to be done with the lack of common sense
customer_reviews.author: PdOffGuy

customer_reviews.title: I'm not blind!
customer_reviews.text: Got them delivered on Sunday. They have the ISO 12312-2 rating on the inside of the glasses. I tested them using an LED flashlight, and then went outside and looked at the sun, I'm not blind. :)
customer_reviews.author: Sarah B

customer_reviews.title: And it was awesome that we got to see the eclipse
customer_reviews.text: These are the real deal. I couldn't see anything except the sun. And it was awesome that we got to see the eclipse! I ordered these at the last minute and got them the day before the eclipse. They were pricey, but that's what I get for waiting until everybody is sold out. These were produced and sent by Lunt Solar Systems, the approved vendor by NASA and the Astronomical Society. No problems with shipping, no problems with the glasses!
customer_reviews.author: MM-California

customer_reviews.title: damaged lens, not usable
customer_reviews.text: 3 of the 10 glasses had what looked like a staple hole through one lens. Not usable.
customer_reviews.author: JFR

customer_reviews.title: EXCELLENT!!
customer_reviews.text: I know the review is way late, but I couldn't have been happier with this purchase. I did a lot of research to be sure I was getting legitimate solar eclipse viewers and this was definitely the real deal. My entire family got to enjoy a once in a lifetime event and our vision is still intact. I don't know if this review will help anyone in the future as they'll likely change designs by then, but as of now I have to say that Lunt is definitely a reputable brand. If I live to see another solar eclipse I'll be happy to give them my business again.
customer_reviews.author: CasualOtaku

customer_reviews.title: Lenses for the masses!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect. My adult son and I were at work during the eclipse on different sides of town. That afternoon he called, so happy to say he had been able to share the experience with dozens of co-workers and elderly residents at his nursing home. I was also able to share the experience at a separate location with dozens of onlookers of all ages, races and nationalities plus two coworkers who did not have glasses. We figured between the two of us and thanks to these great Lunt lenses, close to 100 people got to experience the solar eclipse of a lifetime. Thank you!!
customer_reviews.author: Momofteens

customer_reviews.title: Legit!!
customer_reviews.text: Mine seem legit to me. All of my glasses came in excellent condition, and not folded or crinkled at all. I cannot see any light but the sun, and the sun of just a dull orange ball. Seems like it's working to me. I did order form Lunt Solar Systems themselves through amazon btw. August 21, 2017 solar eclipse, here I come!
customer_reviews.author: Tarmgar

customer_reviews.title: Work fine, but use your hands to hold in place.
customer_reviews.text: I was concerned because they were sent in a large envelope, but they are in great condition. They do not stay in place well and you really need to use your hands to ensure they protect well. That said, I tried one out and I could clearly see the disk of the sun, so they will be perfect come the eclipse. Just remember hold them in place and don't look for more than a few seconds at a time, to protect your vision.
customer_reviews.author: K. G.

customer_reviews.title: Live Dangerously
customer_reviews.text: My order was on back order but they arrived in time for the eclipse. Packaging was fine - a large padded envelope and the 5 pack of glasses were laid out flat inside, so no wrinkles or creases. They claim they are ISO certified. Our entire family might be blind by Tuesday from wearing cheap paper glasses, but I guess you have to live dangerously sometimes. And, with our luck, it'll probably be cloudy anyway. ;)
customer_reviews.author: Solar Powered

customer_reviews.title: Great price for a 5 pack
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these for everyone in my office to view the eclipse with. I didn't want to spend an arm and a leg but I didn't want something that could hurt us. Great price for a 5 pack. These has the certification on them which is a confidence booster for not being fakes. I tried them out by looking at the sun. When you put them on, you cannot see anything (as you shouldn't) but the sun. Pretty weird to see but I'm glad I got these.
customer_reviews.author: M Miller

customer_reviews.title: Ready for Monday
customer_reviews.text: Looking through these glasses you can see----nothing. Except the ball of the sun. This is as it should be. I believe they will work great for the eclipse. I saw the full sun today as a golden ball like a child's drawing.
customer_reviews.author: Carol R. Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Eclipse 2017
customer_reviews.text: Got these to watch the eclipse! Lunt was a recommended reputable brand for solar glasses so I was happy to see them at a great price and speedy delivery with prime!
customer_reviews.author: Jamie Hosseinkhani

customer_reviews.title: Solid Arrival and product... but solid cost too.
customer_reviews.text: Some people said wrinkling was an issue. But they must have changed something. Mine came in a box and were in mint condition. I was worried about them being in a mailbox in the Texas heat but they were brought to the door cause the box was so big. If I were going to knock a star, it would be for the price. Cause 40$ is unnecessary... But I didn't knock a star because they were still in stock so close to the eclipse and certified.
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: Came in perfect pristine shape
customer_reviews.text: Came in perfect pristine shape. Tested and I like the orange color of the sun. Works well for my 8 year old as well as any adult. Too large for my 4 year old.
customer_reviews.author: Marlin Schrock

customer_reviews.title: True certified eclipse viewing glasses.
customer_reviews.text: The glasses worked well for the August eclipse. No pin holes or visible defects. These glasses'' manufacturer had the right NASA and ISO certification to assure full personal safety. Lunt is one of a a limited number of truly certified manufacturers. Their price is a little higher than the knock-offs and it is worth it. The 10 pack was a good count - a couple for the family and a few extra for friends. Highly recommend them if you are eclipse or solar observing. But, use good safety viewing precautions. As mom always said - you only get one pair of eyes.
customer_reviews.author: Ohio Customer

customer_reviews.title: These are great. You can't see anything with them on unless ...
customer_reviews.text: Just got these in the mail and tested them out by looking at the sun. These are great. You can't see anything with them on unless you look directly at the sun with them. Viewing the sun itself is comfortable and shouldn't cause any harm. I've never worn anything so dark before. Well packaged with no damage. Update: Used these to view the total solar eclipse 2017 just north of Geneva, Nebraska. Worked great for the entire family.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan S

customer_reviews.title: I can see clearly now
customer_reviews.text: After having purchased and returned some questionable eclipse glasses and then having the bajeesus scared out of me for my kids permanently losing their eye site and having to take care of them for the next 40+ years, I went with the Lunt glasses and felt safer. (The handicap sticker for the car might have been nice..) We enjoyed the eclipse and the kids could still read their homework the next day. Happy parents, disappointed kids. But I'm writing the review and they're not so I give it 5 stars. Maybe next time Lunt can include a handicap parking sticker though. Just saying..
customer_reviews.author: Keith Blair

customer_reviews.title: Acceptable protection; marked as ISO 12312-2 compliant for direct solar viewing
customer_reviews.text: Product is acceptable. They marked as compliant with ISO 12312-2 for direct solar viewing. They are packaged five to a bunch, unfolded, and shipped inside a plastic sleeve. This should be adequate protection if shipped flat. Mine were received folded in a padded envelope. The fold went through the lens. Therefore one lens is distored across all ten that I received. I mention this as a comment on product durability. The lenses do not hold up well to folding. The lenses are made of a dark plastic film. Despite the fold, I was able to look directly at the noonday sun which looked like an orange ball of light.
customer_reviews.author: Tom L.

customer_reviews.title: Solar Glasses
customer_reviews.text: Paper glasses with solar rated lens. Paid $13 for 5 pairs, so $2 a pair seemed fair priced. I'm in the center line of the Total Eclipse, so excited we have these for our viewing.
customer_reviews.author: TLMKC

customer_reviews.title: Lunt Solar Systems Eclipse Glasses Made Watching The Solar Eclipse Today A Wonderful Experience. Thank you.
customer_reviews.text: These glasses made for a wonderful experience watching the eclipse here in Southern California this morning. We only saw about 69% of totality but it was an incredible sight to watch outdoors, These glasses were used by children from 5 years old to an older 59 year old child and science geek (myself). Extremely satisfied with the product from Lunt Solar Systems. Thank you "Lunt Solar" for making this experience the best it could be for me. You rock!
customer_reviews.author: B. Stone

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: These glasses are approved by NASA and have the ISO certification printed on the inside.
customer_reviews.author: SMNumbers

customer_reviews.title: Have Certification and app to Download Guide.
customer_reviews.text: Mine came nicely packaged. They have the certified labeling and are on the approved list. I cannot see interior lights/light bulbs through them. There is an app on the inside frame that provides a download of the advertised guide (I am glad they did not waste more trees for this). Hopefully all goes well, just really glad I bought them early and not happy with the profiteers out there. If you can't get some for a good price, watch it online.
customer_reviews.author: MomofThreeinPetersTwp

customer_reviews.title: Received in perfect condition. Has the correct ISO certification
customer_reviews.text: I found these through a list approved by my local news station. Received in perfect condition. Has the correct ISO certification. Tested them with lights in the house and was unable to see any lights. Nor did amazon issue a recall/refund to me. With all these factors I am confident these are the correct glasses to wear for the solar eclipse
customer_reviews.author: Consumernerd

customer_reviews.title: Nearly blinded by the light..
customer_reviews.text: Walp...too little too late. I put them on the morning of the eclipse and looked at a kitchen light. I could see the kitchen light through the lenses. Tried a different pair a more (organized & forward thinking) friend had brought along and could NOT see said kitchen lights. Thinking that I might be being overly paranoid I had other people "blind test" (hah...see what I did there?) them. Everyone agreed that they could see light through these and not the other pairs. Obs the show is over and I'm money out. I'm glad I had other options, because risking eyesight doesn't sound like a fun time.
customer_reviews.author: PNW Sam I Am

customer_reviews.title: Great -- nobody went blind!
customer_reviews.text: Price was right....I had ordered some other glasses from another company, but then got scared they wouldn't be delivered in time, so bought these as back up. I ended up getting the original glasses, so gave these to my neighbor who had his family in from out of town & they couldn't find any because the stores had pulled their glasses off the shelves due to safety concerns. My friends were so thankful that I had certified glasses I couldd give them. They all had a good viewing & said they worked just fine -- nobody went blind (ha ha).
customer_reviews.author: smila1000

customer_reviews.title: The Genuine Article!!!
customer_reviews.text: I received my shipment of 10 today as promised. They were shipped by Lunt Solar Systems in a large box and suffered no damage. I tested a pair by looking directly at the sun in a clear sky, which appeared orange and about the size of a full moon through the solar glasses. Indoors, I could barely see my three very bright LED lights at a distance of 4', so I am satisfied that these are the genuine product; safe and suitable for solar viewing by the entire family.
customer_reviews.author: C. Edwards

customer_reviews.title: THE ONLY ECLIPSE GLASSES THAT I COULD VERIFY AS BEING REALLY SAFE ONES
customer_reviews.text: I checked these out completely to make sure they were not fake since a lot of fakes were out there. These and only these were the real deal. I was going to buy a bunch of extras for the next eclipse but it clearly said not to use them if they are over a year old so I'll just wait and buy these and only these later. The also were carefully shipped with no damage. Cracks and other damage would void the whole point of buying them which is to protect eyes from damage.
customer_reviews.author: Mick

customer_reviews.title: Real deal
customer_reviews.text: They are perfect! I tried them yesterday when I got them and I can't see a thing out of them!! As this is the site you are led to from NASA page, and the responses they gave on questions, I trust that they are reputable! Thank you!!!
customer_reviews.author: Tracy Mills

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive and worked as expected
customer_reviews.text: I had a pair given to me from a museum a couple of years ago for a solar event. When I heard of the (now recent) eclipse, I tracked down the old museum 'glasses' to get the brand name and find them online. I knew what I was getting would work. Found them, liked the price, and ordered. hey arrived on time, I set them aside, and handed them out to the family on the big day. I had an extra left. When the office took a break at lunch to watch the eclipse, we passed my glasses around so everyone at least got a glimpse. Big hit!
customer_reviews.author: Steve Erwin

customer_reviews.title: It did the job, and we will likely order again from Lunt Solar Systems
customer_reviews.text: It did the job, and protected our eyes during the solar eclipse. I was nervous that the glasses would work as advertised and they did well. If we get the opportunity to view the next eclipse, I will likely order these Lunt Solar Systems glasses again. They are paper glasses, so I don't expect them to last long really, and we will probably end up discarding them soon. But they protected our eyes well for this solar eclipse event event and that's really what we were looking for here. They were also packaged nicely, arrived in good condition and shipped faster than expected, especially considering they had many other orders for these glasses at that time.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff + Jill Dunbar

customer_reviews.title: Received in a box not an envelope in good condition. Tested and work well
customer_reviews.text: Received in a box not an envelope in good condition. Tested and work well. Home testing on what you should and should not see is avail online. Local TV did a spotlight on this company avail online. Paperwork for the company (Lunt basically just a distributor) and TSE 17 avail online as well. Trusting them with my families sight.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Grateful to have them shipped in time for eclipse
customer_reviews.text: First, I was grateful to get these in time for the ellipse. I bought the pack of 5 which covered my whole family. At the time I ordered these, late in the game, everyone seemed to be sold out. I was worried about my adult kids peeping without protection. They all shared with their friends, co workers and strangers, giving anyone that passed by a chance to use the glasses and enjoy the eclipse. The lenses were rippled on at least one lenses on each pair of glasses but that didn't take away from the protection.
customer_reviews.author: Forever Geralyn

customer_reviews.title: was I ever happy and RELIEVED
customer_reviews.text: Received my packet of 5 solar eclipse glasses in the mail yesterday, just as promised, and BOY, was I ever happy and RELIEVED! Was being very careful to order from one of NASA's recommended companies, so I was sure I had ordered ISO certified glasses, but after reading some of the other reviews about these glasses arriving in damaged condition, I got nervous. But, no, mine came in a box and were perfectly fine and work GREAT when viewing the sun. Can't wait to use these for Solar Eclipse 2017!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: I'm glad we did - that meant we had enough for ...
customer_reviews.text: SOLAR ECLIPSE SUCCESS A bit late in terms of review, I guess, but how do you review before the actual event? We bought the 10 pack because 5 packs were sold out. I'm glad we did - that meant we had enough for us and our grandsons PLUS I shared with families with kids who didn't have glasses purchased and folks at work. Everyone loved the experience and has continued to thank me for sharing. I'm looking into the programs that allow you to recycle these to schools in Indonesia for upcoming solar eclipse events. I won't re-use; we already have a welding helmet (we do, but no, we would not use these glasses while welding - don't be silly).
customer_reviews.author: Kate Charles

customer_reviews.title: Total eclipse of the sun.  Worked for me.
customer_reviews.text: Saw the 2017 total eclipse. I can still see, so the glasses seemed to work just fine. In case you've never used these sort of glasses, they're very different from regular dark glasses. In normal daylight, you'll see nothing at all, except for the sun which will show as a dull orange disk. Don't look at the sun without them. You can also tape one of the filters over a camera lens to allow photography of any solar events.
customer_reviews.author: Martin E

customer_reviews.title: Packaging was perfect. All 10 were packaged together in a plastic ...
customer_reviews.text: Packaging was perfect. All 10 were packaged together in a plastic pouch unbent in a large box. You cannot see anything through these glasses but the sun when you wear these. They are slightly big for my 5 year old, but they fit my 7,11, and 12 year old as well as myself.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: These are legit
customer_reviews.text: These are legit. I also used them in front of my phone and my camera to take pictures. Of course, these don't have much purpose until the next eclipse, unless you just like looking at the sun. They lay flat, so I'll be able to stash them in a drawer until the next eclipse, at which point I'll have forgotten where I put them and buy more. They're pretty cheap, assuming you didn't wait until a few days before the eclipse.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Great condition, real deal
customer_reviews.text: They came quicker than anticipated since it said they were on backorder. Originally said 8/16 arrival. I ordered them Thurs, 8/10 night and they came Monday, 8/14. They came flat with no bends in the glasses. I held them up to the overhead light in my office and no light came through. Looking forward to safely enjoying the solar eclipse on Monday with my co-workers.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: Worked like a charm while viewing the eclipse before and after ...
customer_reviews.text: Worked like a charm while viewing the eclipse before and after totality. Seeing the first bite of the Moon's shadow on the face of the Sun and the slow progress was amazing. Breaths were held as the last bit of the Sun finally disappeared behind the Moon and we could view the corona without protection. And the shout from the crowd of "glasses" when the Sun peeked out and everyone put the glasses back on to watch the Sun return was incredible. We viewed the eclipse in Santee, SC and it was, to quote my grandson, "SURREAL".
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: 5 pack received on time and as promised.
customer_reviews.text: These delivered on time and as described. They have the certification printed on the inside of the glasses. We tested them on an LED light, almost zero pass through, when looking at the sun, it is dull orange with a black sky. Our 5 pack arrived in good condition.
customer_reviews.author: J Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Never buy from this company
customer_reviews.text: was notified only days before a rare event that these were not certified safe to look at the sun even though they specifically stated so. Spent over 100 dollars to get paper ones overnighted so we could see a once in a lifetime event.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Rodgers

customer_reviews.title: I didn't go blind, yaaa
customer_reviews.text: Guess not many of these will be sold any time soon, but mine worked perfect and I did not go blind. I am glad I got a 5 pack, because the price of solar eclipse glasses, as you all know, inflated tremendously in the days prior to the event. I left 2 pairs in my Emergency room for my nurses to watch while they were at work during the solar eclipse. I gave 2 to friends and I kept one which I also shared. Lucky we all got to see the eclipse.
customer_reviews.author: The Grubb Show

customer_reviews.title: Legit: can only see an orange orb and nothing else
customer_reviews.text: These appear authentic and just as described by Amazon. The ISO numbers are exactly as recommended (I realize that these could be listed on a sham/fake pair as well). I did take a peek at the sun through them and it's the only thing I can see through them at all--just an orange colored circle and absolutely nothing else. I have very bright lighting within my home, too, and nothing is visible through these lenses at all. I am very satisfied that they are legit.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good price, great quality, from a professional company...
customer_reviews.text: Good pricing, and great quality. Nice glasses, Lunt is a TSE 17 manufacturer, and have been approved by NASA and the American Astronomical Society. Nice and informative website as well.
customer_reviews.author: TH

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Experience - 2017 Solar Eclipse
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for myself and my teen/adult children. I was so glad that the ISO numbers on the side checked out. Using them during the 2017 solar eclipse was an amazing experience. I was able to put on a pair of these, and put an additional pair over the lens on my phone, turn off the flash, and snap a picture. Hardly anyone else could capture a picture on their phones. I was very please with this purchase. It arrived timely and we have had no ill affects from using them.
customer_reviews.author: kloupe311

customer_reviews.title: HAPPY
customer_reviews.text: 😎 Very excited. Very happy as our solar eclipse glasses arrived. Yes THIS company is legit and NASA etc approved. I knew this when looking for them. I checked under the official telescope and binocular/optic company CELESTRON who deals in high level optics down to 'affordable'. This company LUNT SOLAR SYSTEMS is another related. Hard to get now. And in perfect condition. 😎
customer_reviews.author: Lorifran

customer_reviews.title: All five glasses damaged
customer_reviews.text: The glasses I received were all bent across the lenses exactly where the tbsays do not use if damaged. So I guess all 5 glasses are unusable now and there isn't enough time to get replacements. I'm very upset.
customer_reviews.author: AL Parker

customer_reviews.title: Right Stuff for the Next Eclipse
customer_reviews.text: My one problem: I did a lot of photography practice for the Great U.S. Eclipse the day before, in high heat and humidity. After an hour or so, the sweat had soaked through the first pair, and it simply fell off my face, thankfully not at the wrong time. So it's good to have more than one for yourself. Ultimately I put scotch tape all over the others to sweat-proof them.
customer_reviews.author: Chris P

customer_reviews.title: WORKED GREAT! Recommend Highly
customer_reviews.text: These simple glasses WORKED GREAT. My family & I used these glasses to view the 2017 total solar eclipse and did not experience any problems. I would also like to note that, unlike similar glasses we ordered from another source, these glasses were well packed and properly protected so that they arrived in pristine condition. My thanks to Lunt Solar Systems & Amazon for making this rare eclipse event a safe & trouble-free one for us.
customer_reviews.author: Sheryl Cutler

customer_reviews.title: Poorer packaging rendered unusable
customer_reviews.text: I'm sure these would be great eclipse glasses if they were not bent deliberately right across the lens in order to fit in a tiny box. Why would you do that? And now there's no time to order new ones so we just have to find some other solution. Thanks for ruining a once in a lifetime experience for 5 human beings, including children.
customer_reviews.author: robin perry

customer_reviews.title: Worked great
customer_reviews.text: Ordered ahead of time. Not in stock at time but mailed when promised and arrived ten days ahead of when I needed them. Package arrived intact, well protected, nothing was bent nor wrinkled. Worked GREAT for today's Eclipse! Would order again! Very reasonably priced.
customer_reviews.author: Nurse18

customer_reviews.title: Direct from an ISO and AAS approved source.
customer_reviews.text: Be rest assured, these are directly from an approved manufacturer. They delivered on-time and were packed to ensure no damages would be done. The price you are paying is for a pack of 5. Make sure you donate them after using them instead of tossing the in the trash. Schools and science clubs and museums might need some after the solar eclipse since so many people purchased them.
customer_reviews.author: sjlopez87

customer_reviews.title: THESE PEOPLE ARE LEGIT!
customer_reviews.text: My glasses came a tad late but they are here and they are LEGIT! The right NASA recommendation and for a very reasonable price. I would absolutely use them again. They did NOT raise the price or try to extort me for shipping!! Thank you Lunt!!
customer_reviews.author: AnsleyA

customer_reviews.title: If there's another solar eclipse anytime soon skip these ones.
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure when the next solar eclipse is coming but hopefully by then the technology is Advanced Beyond this. I did use them and I guess it worked. I still have my vision. I'm not sure what other use these things could be used for but at least you get it in bulk.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Franzke

customer_reviews.title: Fast, undamaged, as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: Ordered on the morning of 8/18/2017, for the upcoming solar eclipse. Arrived on the same day (free amazon prime same-say delivery). Came pre-packaged in a small plastic bag to keep them grouped, inside of a very large cardboard box with air cushions. No bending or damage, as other people have experienced. Branded by Lunt, seems to be completely on the up and up. "Tested" them in a room, and the only thing at all visible was a dim image of the coil in a bright light bulb.
customer_reviews.author: Robbie Robertson

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!  Just got them! Definitely real deal!
customer_reviews.text: I didn't know there was such a thing as eclipse glasses until 2 days before the eclipse. After calling around and everyone laughing hat I was actually asking if they had any, I spent $60 on this one in a lifetime thing for 5 pairs. Arrived same day! Just opened them up and they are definitely GREAT! I can not see a thing through them until I look up at the sun.... Pitch black on everything else, so those who doubted, missed out! Worth it! ✌️😎 🌞🌝
customer_reviews.author: Anne F.

customer_reviews.title: Get 4 friends and share this 5 pack.  Or stretch it further and find 8 pirates to view the eclipse with you.
customer_reviews.text: These glasses worked great for viewing the eclipse. I didn't even want to see it, but I knew I would just keep looking at it like a deer in the headlights so I went ahead and got a 5 pack. Months later and my eyes still work. They were horrible for driving the car down the interstate though. Everyone else liked them though, they kept honking to let me know how awesome they looked.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: I received them several days before the eclipse and I was very happy.
customer_reviews.text: I wouldn't buy less than 10. You end up needing them to share and even resell. I purchased these 10 glasses and ended up selling half and more than paid for the cost of originally ordering ten. I was nervous as I ordered only two weeks prior to the eclipse, when everybody was looking for glasses. I wasn't sure they'd make it, and there was a notification that they were delayed. However, I received them several days before the eclipse and I was very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Whittaker

customer_reviews.title: ... damaged when they arrived and just basically all these bad things but they were perfect
customer_reviews.text: I was really scared that these were going to be a scam or damaged when they arrived and just basically all these bad things but they were perfect! They even arrived a few days early so it gave me the chance to check them over and test them on the normal sun so I was very pleased! So glad that i got to experience the solar eclipse and that i was able to share the experience with so many people as well!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied
customer_reviews.text: The glasses were well packed in a large, flat, cardboard box. There were no issues with the lenses. All were in good shape, nothing amiss. I tested and see that they work, making the sun an orange globe, blocking out all else.
customer_reviews.author: Frances Haas

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: So far they are find. I will let you know if I'm blind after the eclipse.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Check ALL lenses before you need them. Had a defective pair.
customer_reviews.text: I took off two stars because we discovered, only today during the eclipse, that one pair was defective. We had not taken them all out until today. We tested two last week. There is a pinhole in each lens of the defective pair. If l had known before, l would have reported it. I can always use them in a shoe box viewer as the pin hole for the next eclipse in 2024. Sigh. Other than that, l like the commemorative print on the front of them. The rest were fine.
customer_reviews.author: Anna Banana

customer_reviews.title: Durable, clear but came really late
customer_reviews.text: This glasses worked perfectly for 21st August event. Durable, clear and right size for kid and adult because of the design of them. Only reason I took out starts from it since it was supposed to come in 2 days and came in 15 days. I am glad I ordered month before the event. Even after the use of couple hrs still looks fine and I bet I can use them for 2024 event too.
customer_reviews.author: Hitesh Patel

customer_reviews.title: Must have!
customer_reviews.text: These worked very well. Ours arrived in perfect shape, shipped in a box. They even fit well over my son's prescription glasses. They are an eclipse must have so I'm not disappointed that I had to pay more than triple the regular price since I waited too long to order them. I was elated that they were back in stock and shipped in time. My advice is order early for 2024!
customer_reviews.author: TC
